subject: Leadership
title: Second-Order Thinking
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Second-Order Thinking.

hook.text: A government offers cash for dead cobras to cut the population. People start breeding cobras. More snakes than ever.

buildup.text: First-order thinking asks: what happens next? Second-order thinking asks: and then what? The chain of consequences.

discovery.text: Howard Marks says most investors think first-order. Superior returns come from seeing what others miss further ahead.

twist.text: Second-order effects often oppose first-order effects. What looks like a clear win today can create problems tomorrow.

climax.text: Train yourself: for every decision, write the direct effect, then ask 'and then what?' at least three times.

punchline.text: Amateurs think one step ahead. Strategists think five.

quiz.question: What is second-order thinking?
options: Thinking about the first obvious result
Considering the chain of consequences beyond the immediate
